result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jared Samuel Nejedlo

records.addlTxt:
8:29 AM Defendant Jared Samuel Nejedlo in court.  Attorney robert James mraz in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Jared Samuel Nejedlo. 
Court calls case.
Court reviews case.
Court heard on jury trial that was begin today, and off record discussions that were held in chambers yesterday.
Victim rights compliance.
ADA heard and moves to dismiss the case.
Victim is present in the courtroom and is heard - requests the case be dismissed.
Atty Spansail has no objections.
Court heard and grants the motion.
Court dismisses the case outright.
8:37 AM
Defendant's Specific Discovery Demand and Update for the Court

10:29 AM Prosecuting attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jared Samuel Nejedlo in court.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Jared Samuel Nejedlo. 
Court calls case. 
Atty spks- case has not been resolved. 
Court reviews jury selection.
12 Jurors + 1 alternate + 4 strikes= 21 jurors up front. 
Court reviews final offer. 
Atty agrees.
Deft agrees. 
Deft rejects final offer. 
Court reviews Prior convictions-0.
Court reviews Witnesses Lists. 
Court approves Officer Nemetz to sit at counsel table for trial. 
Court reviews State's Motion in Limine. 
Court grants Motion. 
Court reviews Deft's Motion in Limine. 
ADA inquires on #9- requests Atty to file Motion. 
Atty to file Motion no later than 12:00 PM on June 28, 2022. 
Court grants Deft's Motion in Limine with the exception of #9. 
Atty spks on amended jury instruction.
Court schedules with parties. 
10:40 AM
Motion hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:01 AM Defendant Jared Samuel Nejedlo in court.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Jared Samuel Nejedlo. Prosecuting attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case. 
Atty spks- case has not been resolved.
Requests to set for trial.
Parties agree to a 2 day trial. 
All motions, proposed verdicts, and proposed jury instruction to be filed no later than end of business day on June 9th, 2022. 
Court schedules with parties. 
11:06 AM
Jury trial scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

09:11 AM Defendant Jared Samuel Nejedlo in court.  DeShea D. Morrow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court calls case.
Deft updates address.
Deft has received copy of complaint. 
Court reviews charges and maximum penalties. 
Deft to talk to public defenders office to determine eligibility. 
9:13 off record. 
9:32 on record. 
Atty Spansail is being heard- deft does qualify for a public defender and will take on case pending conflict of interest check.
Deft has received a copy of complaint and is aware of max penalties and charges- enters not guilty plea. 
DA is being heard on bond. 
Deft is being heard- Victim is his sister and currently resides with her. 
Court imposes- $1,000 signature bond, sign waiver of extradition and no violent contact with Victim N.S. 
Court schedules with parties. 
9:36 AM  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
